intro: Ononis schousboei, commonly known as the Schousboei whitethorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive thorned stems and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Ononis schousboei is often found in shrubland and woodland habitats, contributing to the ecological diversity of its native range.
